intro: Melampodium elottianum, commonly known as the yellow coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its bright yellow petals and a conical, reddish-brown center. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Melampodium elottianum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
